(18 comments)

Allowing this to be different will need to go along with a change to https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/tree/master/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/BIOSConfig to have this configurable. OnReset seems to be the best "default"
Acknowledged
As you wrote this, this is now duplicated.
Done
Please don't declare your own variant types.  Use the common ones in dbus utilty namespace.  Doing what's done here explodes compile times.
Changing this actually caused quite a few changes in how we decipher the attribute, but I think it is working correctly with the common definition.
This can be a normal struct, right?  I don't see it used as a tuple.

All of these are following the same values as found in "xyz/openbmc_project/BIOSConfig/Manager/<common, server, client>.hpp". Because the dbus structures are setup this way I used the same data types to avoid any issues. I was not able to find these structures defined in any generated files in either bmcweb or phosphor-dbus-interfaces

Does my use of "using" make sense now? They are used because that is the "type" being used by the dbus interfaces in the generated code. However the phosphor-dbus-interfaces generated code does not generate the "types" itself.
ACK.  I see the usage now.  Please make sure that there's a comment above each one of these that lists out what the elements are (same as the tuple on line 28).
Done
enum class.  It looks like you've kind of created your own enum class.
Done

This really needs rolled into some classes

I'm not an expert on this stuff, but this is confusing to me, and looks like it might just duplicate a bunch of the generated enums?

I looked for generated structures. There wasn't any in bmcweb or phosphor-dbus-interfaces. There are generated Enums on the Redfish side and in the phosphor-dbus-interfaces generaged code. However there are no generated structures that are passed to and from dbus.
Same question here, since these are being used to Get and Set the properties on dbus I would still need these (for readability) even if we moved to different classes.
I didn't catch that all the "index" enums were indexing into the tuples, not redfish commands.  Just make them enum class and we should be good.
This doesn't appear to be used as a map.  As messy as it might appear, lets make it a std::vector<std::pair<std::string, PendingAttribute>>

So it isn't used as a map specifically but the dbus interface exposes it as a map:
https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/master/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/BIOSConfig/Manager.interface.yaml#L100

So when we call getBIOSManagerProperty<PendingAttributes> or setBIOSManagerProperty<PendingAttributes> it is going to need to be the right structure

Ideally these types of structures would be defined in the generated dbus c++ files but they are not as far as I can find, I was looking.
Done
Please don't use initializer list for json values.
Done

From Redfish spec:
```
This object shall describe BIOS attribute settings as additional properties. If the object specifies a BIOS attribute registry, attributes shall be looked up in that attribute registry by their attribute name.
```

My reading of that is that that be compliant with Redfish, need a registry before we can support this property.

I read it as optional "If the object specifies a BIOS attribute registry..." but either way we need to support the registry, I am wanting to check the spec to see if there are rules about limiting what can be put in Attributes based on the registry, or if that is left to the backend. If we need to load up the registry and check values that will be quite a bit more code that will be going in here.

Lets get some clarity.  This object does specify a BIOS attribute registry, so maybe my reading is different.  Probably best to ask redfish forum.

> If we need to load up the registry and check values that will be quite a bit more code that will be going in here.

Yep, and I think that's intentional in the spec to keep this customized namespace from exploding.

So we are not required to add AttributeRegistry, per the meeting today. However, I agree that we should add it. I am working on it for our gen 1 product currently to ensure I understand the nuances before adding to bmcweb.

I think we should do this in 2 phases:
1. Add the support for static registries and expose the parameter here if set (need to discuses where this is exposed)
2. Add logic to limit the PATCH and PUT to only those in the current registry (I think this can be a setting that allows a service to ignore the validation steps)
No need to make this optional if this is the only supported PATCH parameter.
object_t
Done
Done
Remove..
Sure, I took this from a diff in our fork. We needed to add error messages for all failures and this was picked up. I know upstream bmcweb is not setup to do this.
Done

HA, I wrote a comment and was going to point you to the code, but it looks like you found a bug.

https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/redfish-core/include/utils/json_utils.hpp#L673

That line should be setting messages::unrecognizedRequestBody.  If you want to fix that in another patch, please open it.

I investigated this and determined that adding messages::unrecognizedRequestBody would be redundant as the parseRequestAsJson already sets that message when it fails. I think we are good already as is.
FYI, as you wrote this, this is a fatal exception if Attributes is not an object
Done
This is called out by name in COMMON_ERRORS.md.  Please replace all of them with the appropriate utility functions.
Done
This isn't a flag we check.
Good point, left from our fork, will remove
Done
Please don't write your own version of this helper function.  There's already a utility function for redfish set property.
Done
Please don't do the fanout like this with getProperty.  If you're grabbing multiple properties, use GetAllProperties, and parse.

This only grabs a single property, it was written to consolidate the calls to get the dbus object and get the property from it. The whole reason for this helper was because our sonarqube was complaining about duplicated code since getting the different properties was almost all the same setup steps. I'll change and look for a better solution. And anyway our SQ doesn't even work anymore now that bmcweb uses cpp23
Next time I'll start from scratch instead of pulling in our diff I think, seems to cause more issues

Upstream we have coverity and sonarcloud, both of which seem to work just fine 😊. Feel free to use those reports as needed to help clean things up:
https://sonarcloud.io/summary/new_code?id=edtanous_bmcweb&branch=master
https://scan.coverity.com/projects/openbmc-bmcweb?tab=overview
Acknowledged
double nested labmdas are definitely disallowed
I made the changes. I think moving these from nested lambdas to bind_front type calls might have caused it to be more confusing. But at least it should be more standard
and unit testable! 😊
touche
BTW, that wasn't directed at only you.  I've realized that a lot of folks write code like this, then complain that they can't write unit tests "because it's a lambda"......  obviously

This helper isn't really in line with the rest of computersystem, and definitely shouldn't go in bios namespace.  If you want to do this, happy to discuss this separately.  For this patch, just inline these.
Done
Don't capture request by value.  This makes a very expensive copy.  Parse out the things you need in the first callback, then pass in data structures into next callbacks as required.

This is where I might be getting my c++ wrong, is a capture always by value? Because req is a reference being passed into this function, and it is passed in as a reference later as well. The "req" call itself is needed inside "populatePendingFromRedfish" to call json_util::readJsonPatch. I can look for a refactor of this structure
Done
?  Looks like you missed adding the flag here?
Done
nit, this list is alphabetical.  Please keep it that way.  also, please append redfish- to this option, (so it becomes redfish-bios-settings).
Done
wrap at 80 characters please.
Done
nit, you probably didn't intend to remove these whitespaces?
Done
Remove.  Don't "using" things from other utility namespaces into the redfish namespaces, especially not in a bios handler like this
Done
you duplicate this settings lookup 3 times in this function.  Please don't duplicate it.  Do it once and get a nlohmann::json&
Done
Please create this using a nlohmann::json::array_t.
Done
This URI doesn't look quite correct?
Can you elaborate? This will create  @odata.id": "/redfish/v1/Systems/system/Bios/Settings" by default, which should be the correct URI.
Are these the only 3 types allowed?  Why do we allow both int32 AND int64?

According to Redfish only string and numbers are allowed. I initially was using my own "std::variant<int64_t, std::string>;" which cast all numbers to int64s and used that. However after switching to use "dbus::utility::DbusVariantType" assuming int64 wouldn't work anymore. I would like to assume that all numbers from dbus would become "int32_t" however since DbusVariantType supports both 32 and 64 I wanted to be extra careful to support both.
Pass by Response& if you're not doing async actions.
Done
Take this code.
Done
This is now an unsafe capture by reference.  Call the json parsing in this callback, then pass attributes.
(from the comment on 123) And put it here.
Done
missing HEAD handler.
Done
